edu.jhu.coe.mt
Class Alignment

java.lang.Object
  edu.jhu.coe.mt.Alignment
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
GizaAlignment
public class Alignment
extends Object
implements Serializable

Alignments serve two purposes, both to indicate your system's guessed alignment, and to hold the gold standard alignments. Alignments map index pairs to one of three values, unaligned, possibly aligned, and surely aligned. Your alignment guesses should only contain sure and unaligned pairs, but the gold alignments contain possible pairs as well. To build an alignment, start with an empty one and use addAlignment(i,j,true). To display one, use the render method.

See Also:
Serialized Form

thresholdPosteriors

public Alignment thresholdPosteriors(double[][] posteriors,
                                     double threshold)
Generates an alignment for the same sentence pair according to the supplied posteriors. Posteriors are stored as strengths and above-threshold are stored as sure alignments.

Parameters:
posteriors -
threshold -

output

public String output()
Detects whether this is a soft or hard alignment and writes the appropriate format (soft if available, otherwise hard).

outputHard

public String outputHard()
Writes the sure and proposed alignments in a modified version of the Pharaoh format. For example, if we have 7 sure alignments and two possibles, we get: enPos1-frPos1 enPos2-frPos2 ... enPos8-frPos8-P enPos9-frPos9-P here, the -P indicates possible alignments.

outputSoft

public String outputSoft()
Writes the posterior alignments in a modified version of the Pharaoh format. Each alignment is a triple: enPos-frPos-strength

outputPharaohHard

public String outputPharaohHard()
Writes the sure and proposed alignments in the 0-indexed Pharaoh format. Each alignment is a pair or triple. For example, if we have 7 sure alignments and two possibles, we get: frPos1-enPos1 frPos2-enPos2 ... frPos8-enPos8-P frPos9-enPos9-P here, the -P indicates possible alignments.

outputPharaohHard

public String outputPharaohHard(boolean skipTreeNodes)

outputPharaohSoft

public String outputPharaohSoft()
Writes the alignment strengths in the 0-indexed Pharaoh format. Each alignment is a triple: frPos-enPos-strength

outputPharaohSoft

public String outputPharaohSoft(boolean skipTreeNodes)
